lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
Here are some possibly useful commands:
/todo {description} - Add a todo task to ur task list.
/deadline {description} - Add a deadline task to ur task list.
/event {description} - Add an event task to ur task list.
/list - List out all the tasks in ur task list.
/mark {numerical index} - Mark a specific task done.
/unmark {numerical index} - Mark a specific task undone.
This is a list of features currently supported by Duke.
Duke currently supports _3_ different task types.
Displays a list of all current tasks.
Displays a list of current tasks that match specified keywords.
This command adds a Todo type task to the tasks list.
User will be able to see a message showing details of the newly added Todo task.
This command adds an Event type task to the tasks list. A start and end time is required via the `/start` and `/end` commands.
User will be able to see a message showing details of the newly added Event task.
This command adds a Deadline type task to the tasks list. A cut off time is **_required_** via the `/by` command.
User will be able to see a message showing details of the newly added Deadline task.
### `List` - Displays a list of all current tasks.
User will be able to see a message showing a lists of current tasks.
[MESSAGE] These are the following tasks you have:
This command marks a user-specified task done/undone. A numerical task index is **_required_**.
[MESSAGE] The following task has been marked done: [X] Lunch with John
This command allows the user to find certain tasks with specified keywords. At least 1 keyword is **_required_**.
User will be able to see a list of current tasks that matches **_any_** of the provided keywords.
[MESSAGE] These are the tasks that matched your keyword!
This command allows the user to delete a specified task. A numerical task index is **required**.
[MESSAGE] The following task has been removed: [ ] Lunch with John
Bye! Hope to see you again soon!
* The Duke program implements an application that allows user to keep track of
* different types of tasks they have.
private static Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);

*                                 such as description or cutoff dates/times.
public static void addTask(String command, String arguments) throws MissingCommandException {
throw new MissingCommandException("Please specify a deadline via the /by command!");
"Please specify both start and end dates/times via the /start and /end commands!");

Display.notifyUser("The following task has been removed: [ ] "

Display.notifyUser("These are the following tasks you have:");

* Marks user specified task to be done/undone.

* Loads storage tasks into Duke program.
public static final String HOME = System.getProperty("user.dir");
public static final Path DIRECTORY = Paths.get(HOME, "storage");
public static final Path FILE = Paths.get(HOME, "storage", "savedTasks.txt");
public static final String FILE_PATH = FILE.toString();
* Prepares storage .txt file to be read/edited by Duke program. Creates new
* Loads existing tasks stored in savedTasks.txt file into Duke program task
* Represents a list where all the user created tasks are being stored in
* Duke program. A tasksList object corresponds to an ArrayList
* that contains all tasks created by the user.
public static ArrayList<Task> userTasksList = new ArrayList<>();
* Represents a Deadline task type. A Deadline object corresponds
* to a Task object that requires an additional argument which is
* the cutoff date/time. This is indicated by the user via the /by
* command e.g., /deadline do homework /by sunday evening
* Initialises the superclass Task and sets the description and
* @param arguments user input containing task description and cutoff.
* Represents a Event task type. An Event object corresponds
* to a Task object that requires additional arguments such as the
* start and cutoff dates/times. This is indicated by the user via the
* Initialises the superclass Task and sets the description, start
* @param arguments user input containing task description, start and end
String formatted = "Event:" + super.isDone + ":" + super.description + ":" + startTime + ":" + endTime;
* Represents a task. A Task object represents various possible
* task types such as Event, Deadline or Todo. User may specify their desired
* task type via the respective commands e.g.,
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Represents a Todo task type. A Todo object corresponds
* to a Task object that requires only a description. This is
* provided by the user via the additional words after the /todo
* Represents the messages and warnings displayed to user in the Duke UI.
static public final String MESSAGE_WELCOME = LINE + System.lineSeparator() +
"Hello from\n" + LOGO + System.lineSeparator() + "How can I help you?" + System.lineSeparator()
+ "Here are some possibly useful commands:" + System.lineSeparator() + LINE
+ System.lineSeparator() + "/todo { description } - Add a todo task to ur task list."
"/deadline DESCRIPTION /by CUTOFF - Add a deadline task to ur task list." + System.lineSeparator() +
"/event DESCRIPTION /start START_TIME /end END_TIME - Add an event task to ur task list."
"/list - Lists task(s) in ur task list." + System.lineSeparator() +
"/mark NUMERICAL_INDEX - Mark a specific task done." + System.lineSeparator() +
"/unmark NUMERICAL_INDEX - Mark a specific task undone." + System.lineSeparator() +
"/find KEYWORD [ADDITIONAL KEYWORDS].. - Lists task(s) matching specified keyword(s)"
"/delete NUMERICAL_INDEX - Delete a specific task." + System.lineSeparator() +
static public final String MESSAGE_GOODBYE = LINE + System.lineSeparator() + "Bye! Hope to see you again soon!"
